title: LoggerMiddleware​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Middleware.LoggerMiddleware: Middleware This is to log dispatches out to console

title: new​
content: </> ClickDetector.new( part: Basepart-- The part ) → ClickDetector-- Returns a new ClickDetector object Initalizes a new clickdetector within the part you pass in.

title: setDistance​
content: </> ClickDetector:setDistance( distance: number-- The distance ) → () Sets the distance a player needs to be in order for the MouseClicked event to fire.

content: </> Ranks.Holder: number Holder

title: Color​
content: </> type Color = string Binary string composed of 3 bytes.

title: Vector​
content: </> type Vector = Vector3int16 | Vector3  Vector3 or a Vector3int16

title: Number​
content: </> type Number = string | number Number or string

title: number​
content: </> Deserialize.number(n: Number) → number Deserializes a number

title: color3​
content: </> Deserialize.color3(c: Color) → Color3  Deserializes a Color3 binary string

title: vector3​
content: </> Deserialize.vector3(v: Vector) → Vector3  Deserializes a Vector3

title: number​
content: </> Serialize.number(n: number) → Number
type Number = string | number  Serializes a number.

title: color3​
content: </> Serialize.color3(x: Color3 ) → string Serializes a Color3 into binary string

title: vector3​
content: </> Serialize.vector3(v: Vector3 ) → Vector
type Vector = Vector3int16 | Vector3   Serializes a Vector3. Returns either a vector3 or a Vector3int16 if its all integers

title: table​
content: </> Serialize.table(t: {any}) → {any} Serializes a table deeply.

title: uuid​
content: </> Serialize.uuid() → string Creates a serialized GUID by removing hypens and cuts down the size by half by converting it into a binary string.

title: Action​
content: </> type Action = { type:string, input:any } Action type for dispatching

title: Defaults​
content: </> type Defaults = {[string]:any} String dictionary table for the default attributes

title: State​
content: </> type State = {[string]:any} String dictionary table for the state

title: Reducer​
content: </> type Reducer = ( state: State, action:Action ) → State A function that takes in state and a action and then "reduces" down the state

title: new​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Store.new( defaults: State, reducer: Reducer, middleware: {Middleware} ) → Store Creates a new store.

title: dispatch​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Store:dispatch(action: Action) → () Dispatches a action to the store

title: getState​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Store:getState() → State Gets the current state

title: Destroy​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Store:Destroy() → nil Destroys the store, rendering it completely unsuable.

title: Store​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Attributes.Store: Store This is to manage state for attributes

title: Middleware​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Attributes.Middleware: Middleware This is to manage state for attributes

title: Component​
content: </> type Component = {[string]:any} React component

title: Theme​
content: </> type Theme = {[string]:any} Theming table, see default theme in src/ReplicatedStorage/Themes/Default.lua for a template to follow.

title: Context​
content: </> Components.Context: Context React context for current theme.

title: Changed​
content: </> Components.Changed: Signal Fires when the theme gets updated

title: Theme​
content: </> Components.Theme: Component Theme component controller

title: GetComponent​
content: </> Components:GetComponent(Name: string) → Component Gets a themed version of a roblox base component such as a textbutton, frame, imagebutton.

title: GetController​
content: </> Components:GetController(Name: string) → Component Returns a controller object. Anything that the player interacts with such as sliders, dropdowns, radios.

title: GetBase​
content: </> Components:GetBase(Name: string) → Component Gets a base component. This includes things such as Window, Document

title: GetPadding​
content: </> Components:GetPadding(Name: string) → Component Gets a padding component. This includes things such as Box, Text

title: GetMain​
content: </> Components:GetMain(Name: string) → Component Gets a main component. This is a convienent way of getting your UI that you built.

title: SetTheme​
content: </> Components:SetTheme(theme: Theme) → nil Sets the UI theme. See default theme in src/ReplicatedStorage/Themes/Default.lua for a template to follow.

title: MouseIconEnabled​
content: </> Mouse.MouseIconEnabled: boolean This is a proxy for UserInputService.MouseIconEnabled

title: Icon​
content: </> Mouse.Icon: string This is a proxy for UserInputService.MouseIcon

title: X​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.X: number Mouse's X coordinate

title: Y​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.Y: number Mouse's Y coordinate

title: Move​
content: </> Mouse.Move: Signal Mouse moved event

title: Button1Down​
content: </> Mouse.Button1Down: Signal Player right click down

title: Button1Up​
content: </> Mouse.Button1Up: Signal Player right click up

title: Button2Down​
content: </> Mouse.Button2Down: Signal Player left click down

title: Button2Up​
content: </> Mouse.Button2Up: Signal Player left click up

title: WheelForward​
content: </> Mouse.WheelForward: Signal Player mouse wheel forward

title: WheelBackward​
content: </> Mouse.WheelBackward: Signal Player mouse wheel backward

title: Idle​
content: </> Mouse.Idle: Signal Player mouse idle

title: ViewSizeX​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.ViewSizeX: number Player viewport size X

title: ViewSizeY​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.ViewSizeY: number Player viewport size X

title: TargetFilter​
content: </> Mouse.TargetFilter: {Instance } | Instance  Player filter for the mouse. Checks descendants too.

title: Hit​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.Hit: CFrame | nil Hit location on Basepart.

title: TargetNormal​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.TargetNormal: Vector3  The surface normal we are hovering on the Target

title: TargetSurface​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.TargetSurface: NormalId  The surface we are hovering on the Target

title: Target​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.Target: BasePart  The Basepart we are hovering over.

title: Origin​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.Origin: Vector3  The origin of the mouse ray.

title: UnitRay​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.UnitRay: Ray  The mouse ray

title: Direction​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.Direction: Vector3  The direction of the mouse ray

title: End​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Mouse.End: Vector3  The end of the mouse ray
